info.title: TiDB Cloud Starter and Essential API
info.description:
*TiDB Cloud API is in beta.*

This API manages [TiDB Cloud Starter](https://docs.pingcap.com/tidbcloud/select-cluster-tier/#tidb-cloud-serverless) and [TiDB Cloud Essential](https://docs.pingcap.com/tidbcloud/select-cluster-tier/#essential) clusters. For [TiDB Cloud Dedicated](https://docs.pingcap.com/tidbcloud/select-cluster-tier/#tidb-cloud-dedicated) clusters, use the [TiDB Cloud Dedicated API](https://docs.pingcap.com/tidbcloud/api/v1beta1/dedicated/). For more information about TiDB Cloud API, see [TiDB Cloud API Overview](https://docs.pingcap.com/tidbcloud/api-overview/).

# Overview

The TiDB Cloud API is a [REST interface](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Representational_state_transfer) that provides you with programmatic access to manage clusters and related resources within TiDB Cloud.

The API has the following features:

- **JSON entities.** All entities are expressed in JSON.
- **HTTPS-only.** You can only access the API via HTTPS, ensuring all the data sent over the network is encrypted with TLS.
- **Key-based access and digest authentication.** Before you access TiDB Cloud API, you must generate an API key. All requests are authenticated through [HTTP Digest Authentication](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digest_access_authentication), ensuring the API key is never sent over the network.

# Get Started

This guide helps you make your first API call to TiDB Cloud API. You'll learn how to authenticate a request, build a request, and interpret the response.

## Prerequisites

To complete this guide, you need to perform the following tasks:

- Create a [TiDB Cloud account](https://tidbcloud.com/free-trial)
- Install [curl](https://curl.se/)

## Step 1. Create an API key

To create an API key, log in to your TiDB Cloud console. Navigate to the [**API Keys**](https://tidbcloud.com/org-settings/api-keys) page of your organization, and create an API key.

An API key contains a public key and a private key. Copy and save them in a secure location. You will need to use the API key later in this guide.

For more details about creating API keys, refer to [API Key Management](#section/Authentication/API-Key-Management).

## Step 2. Make your first API call

### Build an API call

TiDB Cloud API call consists of the following components:

- **A host**. The host for TiDB Cloud API is <https://serverless.tidbapi.com>.
- **An API Key**. The public key and the private key are required for authentication.
- **A request**. When submitting data to a resource via `POST`, `PATCH`, or `PUT`, you must submit your payload in JSON.

In this guide, you call the [List all clusters](#tag/Cluster/operation/ClusterService_ListClusters) endpoint. For the detailed description of the endpoint, see the [API reference](#tag/Cluster/operation/ClusterService_ListClusters).

### Call an API endpoint

To get all clusters in your organization, run the following command in your terminal. Remember to change `YOUR_PUBLIC_KEY` to your public key and `YOUR_PRIVATE_KEY` to your private key.

```shell
curl --digest \
 --user 'YOUR_PUBLIC_KEY:YOUR_PRIVATE_KEY' \
 --request GET \
 --url 'https://serverless.tidbapi.com/v1beta1/clusters'
```

## Step 3. Check the response

After making the API call, if the status code in response is `200` and you see details about all clusters in your organization, your request is successful.

# Authentication

The TiDB Cloud API uses [HTTP Digest Authentication](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digest_access_authentication). It protects your private key from being sent over the network. For more details about HTTP Digest Authentication, refer to the [IETF RFC](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7616).

## API key overview

- The API key contains a public key and a private key, which act as the username and password required in the HTTP Digest Authentication. The private key only displays upon the key creation.
- The API key belongs to your organization and acts as the `Organization Owner` role. You can check [permissions of owner](https://docs.pingcap.com/tidbcloud/manage-user-access#configure-member-roles).
- You must provide the correct API key in every request. Otherwise, TiDB Cloud responds with a `401` error.

## API key management

### Create an API key

Only the **owner** of an organization can create an API key.

To create an API key in an organization, perform the following steps:

1. In the [TiDB Cloud console](https://tidbcloud.com), switch to your target organization using the combo box in the upper-left corner.
2. In the left navigation pane, click **Organization Settings** > **API Keys**.
3. On the **API Keys** page, click **Create API Key**.
4. Enter a description for your API key. The role of the API key is always `Organization Owner` currently.
5. Click **Next**. Copy and save the public key and the private key.
6. Make sure that you have copied and saved the private key in a secure location. The private key only displays upon the creation. After leaving this page, you will not be able to get the full private key again.
7. Click **Done**.

### View details of an API key

To view details of an API key, perform the following steps:

1. In the [TiDB Cloud console](https://tidbcloud.com), switch to your target organization using the combo box in the upper-left corner.
2. In the left navigation pane, click **Organization Settings** > **API Keys**.
3. You can view the details of the API keys on the page.

### Edit an API key

Only the **owner** of an organization can modify an API key.

To edit an API key in an organization, perform the following steps:

1. In the [TiDB Cloud console](https://tidbcloud.com), switch to your target organization using the combo box in the upper-left corner.
2. In the left navigation pane, click **Organization Settings** > **API Keys**.
3. On the **API Keys** page, click **...** in the API key row that you want to change, and then click **Edit**.
4. You can update the API key description.
5. Click **Update**.

### Delete an API key

Only the **owner** of an organization can delete an API key.

To delete an API key in an organization, perform the following steps:

1. In the [TiDB Cloud console](https://tidbcloud.com), switch to your target organization using the combo box in the upper-left corner.
2. In the left navigation pane, click **Organization Settings** > **API Keys**.
3. On the **API Keys** page, click **...** in the API key row that you want to delete, and then click **Delete**.
4. Click **I understand, delete it.**

# Rate Limiting

The TiDB Cloud API allows up to 100 requests per minute per API key. If you exceed the rate limit, the API returns a `429` error. For more quota, you can [submit a request](https://support.pingcap.com/hc/en-us/requests/new?ticket_form_id=7800003722519) to contact our support team.

Each API request returns the following headers about the limit.

- `X-Ratelimit-Limit-Minute`: The number of requests allowed per minute. It is 100 currently.
- `X-Ratelimit-Remaining-Minute`: The number of remaining requests in the current minute. When it reaches `0`, the API returns a `429` error and indicates that you exceed the rate limit.
- `X-Ratelimit-Reset`: The time in seconds at which the current rate limit resets.

If you exceed the rate limit, an error response returns like this.

```
> HTTP/2 429
> date: Fri, 22 Jul 2022 05:28:37 GMT
> content-type: application/json
> content-length: 66
> x-ratelimit-reset: 23
> x-ratelimit-remaining-minute: 0
> x-ratelimit-limit-minute: 100
> x-kong-response-latency: 2
> server: kong/2.8.1

> {"details":[],"code":49900007,"message":"The request exceeded the limit of 100 times per apikey per minute. For more quota, please contact us: https://support.pingcap.com/hc/en-us/requests/new?ticket_form_id=7800003722519"}
```

# API Changelog

This changelog lists all changes to the TiDB Cloud API.

<!-- In reverse chronological order -->

## 20250812

- Initial release of the TiDB Cloud Starter and Essential API, including the following resources and endpoints:

    - Cluster:
        - [List TiDB Cloud Starter and Essential clusters](#tag/Cluster/operation/ClusterService_ListClusters)
        - [Create a new TiDB Cloud Starter or Essential cluster](#tag/Cluster/operation/ClusterService_CreateCluster)
        - [Get details of a TiDB Cloud Starter or Essential cluster](#tag/Cluster/operation/ClusterService_GetCluster)
        - [Delete a TiDB Cloud Starter or Essential cluster](#tag/Cluster/operation/ClusterService_DeleteCluster)
        - [Update a TiDB Cloud Starter or Essential cluster](#tag/Cluster/operation/ClusterService_PartialUpdateCluster)
        - [List available regions for an organization](#tag/Cluster/operation/ClusterService_ListRegions)
    - Branch:
        - [List branches](#tag/Branch/operation/BranchService_ListBranches)
        - [Create a branch](#tag/Branch/operation/BranchService_CreateBranch)
        - [Get details of a branch](#tag/Branch/operation/BranchService_GetBranch)
        - [Delete a branch](#tag/Branch/operation/BranchService_DeleteBranch)
        - [Reset a branch](#tag/Branch/operation/BranchService_ResetBranch)
    - Export:
        - [List export tasks for a cluster](#tag/Export/operation/ExportService_ListExports)
        - [Create an export task](#tag/Export/operation/ExportService_CreateExport)
        - [Get details of an export task](#tag/Export/operation/ExportService_GetExport)
        - [Delete an export task](#tag/Export/operation/ExportService_DeleteExport)
        - [Cancel an export task](#tag/Export/operation/ExportService_CancelExport)
    - Import:
        - [List import tasks for a cluster](#tag/Import/operation/ImportService_ListImports)
        - [Create an import task](#tag/Import/operation/ImportService_CreateImport)
        - [Get an import task](#tag/Import/operation/ImportService_GetImport)
        - [Cancel an import task](#tag/Import/operation/ImportService_CancelImport)

get.summary: List TiDB Cloud Starter and Essential clusters

401.description: The API key cannot be authenticated.

403.description: The API key does not have permission to access the resource.

429.description: You have exceed the rate limit.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The maximum number of clusters to return. If not specified, at most 10 clusters will be returned. The maximum value is `100`. Values greater than `100` are set to `100`.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description:
The pagination token received from a previous [List clusters](#tag/Cluster/operation/ClusterService_ListClusters) request. Use this token to retrieve the next page of results.

**Note**: When paginating, all other parameters must match the original request.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
An expression that filters the list of clusters based on specific criteria. Uses Google AIP syntax with `=` and `AND` operators. You can filter by `region`, `state`, `projectId`, `clusterId`, `displayName`, and `labels`.

**Available filters**:
- `region.provider`: the cloud provider where the cluster is located, such as `aws` or `alicloud`.
- `region.name`: the name of the region where the cluster is located, in the format of `regions/{provider}-{region}`, such as `regions/aws-us-east-1`.
- `state`: the state of the cluster state, such as `ACTIVE` or `CREATING`.
- `projectId`: the ID of the project ID. You can specify multiple values separated by commas.
- `clusterId`: the ID of the cluster. You can specify multiple values separated by commas.
- `displayName`: the display name of the cluster.
- `labels.{key}`: the labels of the cluster labels, such as `labels.environment=production`.

**Examples**:
- `filter=region.provider="aws" AND state="ACTIVE"`
- `filter=projectId=12345 AND displayName="my-cluster"`

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The number of clusters to skip before returning results. If the value exceeds the total number of clusters, the response is `200` with an empty list and no `nextPageToken`.

post.summary: Create a new TiDB Cloud Starter or Essential cluster

401.description: The API key cannot be authenticated.

403.description: The API key does not have permission to access the resource.

429.description: You have exceed the rate limit.

parameters.description: The cluster to create.

get.summary: Get details of a TiDB Cloud Starter or Essential cluster

401.description: The API key cannot be authenticated.

403.description: The API key does not have permission to access the resource.

429.description: You have exceed the rate limit.

parameters.name: clusterId
parameters.description: The ID of the cluster to retrieve.

parameters.name: view
parameters.description:
The detail level of the cluster information to return.

- `BASIC`: returns only basic cluster information.
- `FULL`: returns complete cluster details.

parameters.name: cluster.clusterId
parameters.description: The ID of the cluster to update.

get.summary: List export tasks for a cluster

401.description: The API key cannot be authenticated.

403.description: The API key does not have permission to access the resource.

429.description: You have exceed the rate limit.

parameters.name: clusterId
parameters.description: The ID of the cluster to list export tasks for.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The maximum number of exports to return. If not specified, at most 10 exports will be returned. The maximum value is `100`. Values greater than `100` are set to `100`.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description:
The pagination token received from a previous [List export tasks](#tag/Export/operation/ExportService_ListExports) request. Use this token to retrieve the next page of results.

**Note**: When paginating, all other parameters must match the original request.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description:
Specifies the sorting order of results. Use a comma-separated list of field names, optionally appending `desc` for descending order. For example, `createTime desc`. By default, fields are sorted in ascending order.

Supported field: `createTime`.

parameters.name: orderBy

Specifies the sorting order of results. Use a comma-separated list of field names, optionally appending `desc` for descending order. For example, `createTime desc`. By default, fields are sorted in ascending order.

parameters.name: clusterId
parameters.description: The ID of the cluster.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the import task.

monthly.description: The maximum spending limit for the cluster per month, in USD cents.

where.description: Filters the exported tables with the `WHERE` condition.

exportOptions.description: The configuration options for the export task.

target.description: The destination configuration for where the exported data is stored.

displayName.description: The display name of the export task.

importOptions.description: The configuration options for the import task.

source.description: The data source for the import task.

serviceName.description: The Alibaba Cloud service name for private access.

availabilityZone.description: A list of availability zones where the service is available.

PrivateALICLOUD.description: The [Alibaba Cloud PrivateLink](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/en/privatelink/product-overview/what-is-a-private-network-connection) configuration for private access.

commonv1beta1ClusterState.description:
Enum of possible states of a cluster.

 - CREATING: Cluster is being created.
 - ACTIVE: Cluster is active for use.
 - RESTORING: Cluster data is being restored.
 - DELETED: Cluster has been deleted.

name.description: The unique name of the region, in the format of `regions/{region_id}`. For example, `regions/aws-us-west-2`.

regionId.description: The unique identifier of the region, in the format of `{cloud_provider}-{region_code}`. For example, `aws-us-west-2`.

cloudProvider.description:
The cloud provider that offers the region.

- `"aws"`: Amazon Web Services

- `"alicloud"`: Alibaba Cloud

displayName.description: A human-readable name for the region. For example, `Oregon (us-west-2)`.

provider.description: **Deprecated.** Use `cloudProvider` instead. The name of the cloud provider. For example, `aws` or `alicloud`.

servicePlans.description:
The plan of the service.

- `Starter`: [TiDB Cloud Starter](https://docs.pingcap.com/tidbcloud/select-cluster-tier/#tidb-cloud-serverless)
- `Essential`: [TiDB Cloud Essential](https://docs.pingcap.com/tidbcloud/select-cluster-tier/#essential)

commonv1beta1Region.description: A representation of a region for deploying TiDB clusters.

code.description: The error code returned with this error.

message.description: The error message returned with this error.

details.description: A list of messages with additional error details.

googlerpcStatus.description:
The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for
different programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is
used by [gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). Each `Status` message contains
three pieces of data: error code, error message, and error details.

You can find out more about this error model and how to work with it in the
[API Design Guide](https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/errors).

@type.description: A URL or resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized protocol buffer message.

serverlessv1beta1ClusterHighAvailability.description:
The high availability configuration for the cluster.

- `ZONAL`: high availability within a single availability zone. For more information, see [Zonal high availability architecture](https://docs.pingcap.com/tidbcloud/serverless-high-availability/#zonal-high-availability-architecture).
- `REGIONAL`: high availability across multiple availability zones within a region. For more information, see [Regional high availability architecture](https://docs.pingcap.com/tidbcloud/serverless-high-availability/#regional-high-availability-architecture).

name.description: The unique identifier for the TiDB cluster, which is generated by the API and follows the format `clusters/{clusterId}`.

displayName.description: The user-defined name of the cluster.

region.description: The region where the cluster is deployed.

automatedBackupPolicy.description: The schedule and retention rules for automated database backups.

endpoints.description: The connection endpoints for accessing the cluster.

rootPassword.description: The root password of the cluster. It must be between 8 and 64 characters long and can contain letters, numbers, and special characters.

encryptionConfig.description: The data encryption settings for the cluster.

version.description: The TiDB version of the cluster.

createdBy.description: The email address of the user who create the cluster.

userPrefix.description: The unique prefix automatically generated for SQL usernames on this cluster. TiDB Cloud uses this prefix to distinguish between clusters. For more information, see [User name prefix](https://docs.pingcap.com/tidbcloud/select-cluster-tier/#user-name-prefix).

state.description: The current state of the cluster.

labels.description:
The labels for the cluster.

- `tidb.cloud/organization`: the ID of the organization where the cluster belongs.
- `tidb.cloud/project`: the ID of the project where the cluster belongs.

annotations.description:
The annotations for the cluster. The following lists some predefined annotations.

- `tidb.cloud/has-set-password`: indicates whether the cluster has a root password set.
- `tidb.cloud/available-features`: lists available features of the cluster.

createTime.description: The timestamp when the cluster was created, in the [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.

updateTime.description: The timestamp when the cluster was last updated, in the [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.

autoScaling.description: The auto-scaling configuration for the cluster.

servicePlan.description:
The plan of the service.

- `Starter`: [TiDB Cloud Starter](https://docs.pingcap.com/tidbcloud/select-cluster-tier/#tidb-cloud-serverless)
- `Essential`: [TiDB Cloud Essential](https://docs.pingcap.com/tidbcloud/select-cluster-tier/#essential)

tidb_cloud_open_apiserverlessv1beta1Clus.description: Message for a TiDB Cloud Starter or Essential cluster.

clusters.description: A list of clusters that match the query.

nextPageToken.description: The token to retrieve the next page of results. Use this value as the `pageToken` parameter in the next request. This field is empty when there are no more pages.

totalSize.description: The total number of clusters that match the query.

tidb_cloud_open_apiserverlessv1beta1List.description: Responses message to the request for listing of TiDB Cloud Starter and Essential clusters.
Responses message to the request for listing of available regions in TiDB Cloud Starter and Essential.

authType.description: The authentication method for accessing the Azure Blob Storage source.

sasToken.description: The Shared Access Signature (SAS) token for accessing the Azure Blob Storage source.

uri.description: The Azure Blob Storage URI of the import source, in the format of `azure://<account>.blob.core.windows.net/<container>/<path>` or `https://<account>.blob.core.windows.net/<container>/<path>`.

authType.description: The authentication method for accessing Azure Blob Storage.

sasToken.description: The Shared Access Signature (SAS) token for accessing Azure Blob Storage.

uri.description: The Azure Blob URI of the export target, in the format of `azure://<account>.blob.core.windows.net/<container>/<path>` or `https://<account>.blob.core.windows.net/<container>/<path>`.

name.description: The unique identifier for the branch.

branchId.description: The system-generated ID of the branch.

displayName.description: The user-defined name of the branch.

rootPassword.description: The root password of the cluster. It must be between 8 and 64 characters long and can contain letters, numbers, and special characters.

clusterId.description: The ID of the cluster to which the branch belongs.

parentId.description: The ID of the branch parent.

createdBy.description: The email address of the user who create the branch.

endpoints.description: The connection endpoints for accessing the branch.

userPrefix.description: The unique prefix automatically generated for SQL usernames on this cluster. TiDB Cloud uses this prefix to distinguish between clusters. For more information, see [User name prefix](https://docs.pingcap.com/tidbcloud/select-cluster-tier/#user-name-prefix).

createTime.description: The timestamp when the branch was created, in the [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.

updateTime.description: The timestamp when the branch was last updated, in the [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.

parentDisplayName.description: The display name of the parent branch from which the branch was created.

parentTimestamp.description: The point in time on the parent branch from which the branch is created. The timestamp is truncated to seconds without rounding.

public.description: The public endpoint configuration for connecting to the branch.

private.description: The private endpoint for securely connecting to the branch.

v1beta1BranchEndpoints.description: Message for the Endpoints for this branch.

host.description: The hostname of the private endpoint.

port.description: The port number of the private endpoint.

aws.description: The [AWS PrivateLink](https://aws.amazon.com/privatelink/) configuration details for private access.

v1beta1BranchEndpointsPrivate.description: Message for Private Endpoint for this branch.

serviceName.description: The AWS service name for private access.

availabilityZone.description: A list of availability zones where the service is available.

v1beta1BranchEndpointsPrivateAWS.description: Message for AWS Private Link Service.

host.description: The hostname of the public endpoint.

port.description: The port number of the public endpoint.

disabled.description: Indicates whether the public endpoint is disabled.

authorizedNetworks.description: The list of networks that are allowed to connect to the branch.

v1beta1BranchEndpointsPublic.description: Message for Public Endpoint for this branch.

displayName.description: The display name of the authorized network.

startIpAddress.description: The starting IP address of the authorized network range.

endIpAddress.description: The ending IP address of the authorized network range.

v1beta1BranchState.description:
Branch State.

 - CREATING: The branch is creating.
 - ACTIVE: The branch is active and running.
 - DELETED: The branch is deleted.
 - RESTORING: The branch is restoring.

minRcu.description: The minimum number of Request Capacity Units (RCUs) for auto-scaling.

maxRcu.description: The maximum number of Request Capacity Units (RCUs) for auto-scaling.

startTime.description: The UTC time of day in `HH:mm` format when the automated backup starts.

retentionDays.description: The number of days to retain automated backups.

v1beta1ClusterAutomatedBackupPolicy.description: Message for automated backup configuration for a cluster.

enhancedEncryptionEnabled.description: Indicates whether enhanced encryption for cluster data is enabled.

v1beta1ClusterEncryptionConfig.description: Message for encryption settings for a cluster.

public.description: The public endpoint configuration for connecting to the cluster. For more information, see [Network](https://docs.pingcap.com/tidbcloud/connect-to-tidb-cluster-serverless/#network).

private.description: The private endpoint for securely connecting to the cluster. For more information, see [Network](https://docs.pingcap.com/tidbcloud/connect-to-tidb-cluster-serverless/#network).

v1beta1ClusterEndpoints.description: Message for endpoint information for connecting to a cluster.

host.description: The hostname of the private endpoint.

port.description: The port number of the private endpoint.

v1beta1ClusterEndpointsPrivate.description: Message for private endpoint to securely connect to the cluster.

serviceName.description: The AWS service name for private access.

availabilityZone.description: A list of availability zones where the service is available.

v1beta1ClusterEndpointsPrivateAWS.description: The [AWS PrivateLink](https://aws.amazon.com/privatelink/) configuration details for private access.

host.description: The hostname of the public endpoint.

port.description: The port number of the public endpoint.

disabled.description: Indicates whether the public endpoint is disabled.

authorizedNetworks.description: The list of networks that are allowed to connect to the cluster.

v1beta1ClusterEndpointsPublic.description: Message for public endpoint to connect to the cluster.

startIpAddress.description: The starting IP address of the authorized network range.

endIpAddress.description: The ending IP address of the authorized network range.

displayName.description: The display name of the authorized network.
The user-defined name of the cluster.

automatedBackupPolicy.description: The schedule and retention rules for automated database backups.

endpoints.description: The connection endpoints for accessing the cluster.

labels.description:
The labels for the cluster.

- `tidb.cloud/organization`: the ID of the organization where the cluster belongs.
- `tidb.cloud/project`: the ID of the project where the cluster belongs.

autoScaling.description: The auto-scaling configuration for the cluster.

updateMask.description: Specifies which fields to update in the cluster.

v1beta1ClusterServicePartialUpdateCluste.description: Message for requesting a partial update on a TiDB Cloud Starter or Essential cluster.

importOptions.description: The configuration options for the import task.

source.description: The data source for the import task.

exportId.description: The unique ID of the export task.

name.description: The unique identifier for the export task.

clusterId.description: The ID of the cluster to which the export task belongs.

createdBy.description: The email address of the user who create the export task.

state.description: The state of the export task.

exportOptions.description: The configuration options for the export task.

target.description: The destination configuration for where the exported data is stored.

reason.description: An error message if the export task failed. Otherwise, empty.

displayName.description: The display name of the export task.

createTime.description: The timestamp when the export task was created, in the [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.

updateTime.description: The timestamp when the export task was last updated, in the [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.

completeTime.description: The timestamp when the export task was completed, in the [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.

snapshotTime.description: The timestamp when the data snapshot was captured for this export.

expireTime.description: The timestamp when the export will expire and become unavailable.

v1beta1ExportAzureBlobAuthTypeEnum.description: - SAS_TOKEN: The access method is sas token.

v1beta1ExportCompressionTypeEnum.description:
- GZIP: Gzip compression.
 - SNAPPY: Snappy compression.
 - ZSTD: Zstd compression.
 - NONE: No compression.

v1beta1ExportFileTypeEnum.description:
- SQL: SQL type.
 - CSV: CSV type.
 - PARQUET: PARQUET type.

v1beta1ExportGcsAuthTypeEnum.description: - SERVICE_ACCOUNT_KEY: The access method is service account key.

v1beta1ExportOSSAuthTypeEnum.description: - ACCESS_KEY: The access method is access key.

compression.description: The compression algorithm of the export file.

filter.description: Defines which tables to include in the export. If not specified, all tables in the cluster are exported.

csvFormat.description: The format specification for the CSV file.

parquetFormat.description: The format specification for the Parquet file.

separator.description:
The character used to separate values in the CSV file.
It is recommended to use uncommon separators like `|+|` to avoid conflicts.

delimiter.description: The character used to enclose string values in the CSV file.

nullValue.description: The string representation of NULL values in the CSV file.

skipHeader.description: Indicates whether to omit the header row in exported CSV files.

sql.description: Filters the exported data with the SQL statement.

table.description: Filters the exported data with table filter patterns.

v1beta1ExportParquetCompressionTypeEnum.description:
- GZIP: The parquet compression type is GZIP.
 - SNAPPY: The parquet compression type is SNAPPY.
 - ZSTD: The parquet compression type is ZSTD.
 - NONE: No compression.

v1beta1ExportS3AuthTypeEnum.description:
- ROLE_ARN: The access method is role arn.
 - ACCESS_KEY: The access method is access key.

v1beta1ExportStateEnum.description:
Export State.

 - RUNNING: The export task is being created.
 - SUCCEEDED: The export task is success.
 - FAILED: The export task is failed.
 - CANCELED: The export task is canceled.
 - DELETED: The export task is deleted.
 - EXPIRED: The export is expired, only local export will be expired.

s3.description: The configuration details for exporting data to Amazon S3. This is required when `type` is `S3`.

gcs.description: The configuration details for exporting data to Google Cloud Storage. This is required when `type` is `GCS`.

azureBlob.description: The configuration details for exporting data to Azure Blob Storage. This is required when `type` is `AZURE_BLOB`.

oss.description: The configuration details for exporting data to Alibaba Cloud Object Storage Service (OSS). This is required when `type` is `OSS`.

v1beta1ExportTargetTypeEnum.description:
- LOCAL: Local target.
 - S3: S3 target.
 - GCS: gcs target.
 - AZURE_BLOB: azure blob target.
 - OSS: OSS target.

uri.description: The Google Cloud Storage URI of the import source.

authType.description: The authentication method for accessing the Google Cloud Storage source.

serviceAccountKey.description: The service account key for accessing the Google Cloud Storage source.

uri.description: The Google Cloud Storage URI of the export target.

authType.description: The authentication method for accessing Google Cloud Storage.

serviceAccountKey.description: The service account key for accessing Google Cloud Storage.

id.description: **Deprecated.** Use `importId` instead. The ID of the import task.

name.description: The name of the import task.

clusterId.description: The ID of the target cluster for the import.

totalSize.description: The total size of the data to be imported, in bytes.

createTime.description: The timestamp when the import task was created, in the [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.

completeTime.description: The timestamp when the import task was completed, in the [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.

state.description: The state of the import task.

completePercent.description: The percentage of import progress, excluding post-processing.

message.description: An error message if the import task failed. Otherwise, empty.

createdBy.description: The email address of the user who create the import task.

creationDetails.description: The additional details about how the import task is created.

importId.description: The ID of the import task.

v1beta1ImportAzureBlobAuthTypeEnum.description: - SAS_TOKEN: The access method is sas token.

v1beta1ImportFileTypeEnum.description:
- CSV: CSV type.
 - SQL: SQL type.
 - AURORA_SNAPSHOT: Aurora snapshot type.
 - PARQUET: Parquet type.

v1beta1ImportGcsAuthTypeEnum.description: - SERVICE_ACCOUNT_KEY: The access method is service account key.

v1beta1ImportOSSAuthTypeEnum.description: - ACCESS_KEY: The access method is access key.

fileType.description: The format of the file to import.

csvFormat.description: The format specification for CSV files.

separator.description: The character used to separate values in the CSV file.

delimiter.description: The character used to enclose string values in the CSV file.

header.description: Indicates whether the CSV file contains column headers in the first row.

notNull.description: Indicates whether the columns in the CSV file can be NULL.

null.description: The string representation of NULL values in the CSV file.

backslashEscape.description: Indicates whether to escape backslashes in the CSV file.

trimLastSeparator.description: Indicates whether to remove trailing separators from each row in the CSV file.

v1beta1ImportS3AuthTypeEnum.description:
- ROLE_ARN: The access method is role arn.
 - ACCESS_KEY: The access method is access key.

v1beta1ImportS3CompatibleAuthTypeEnum.description: - ACCESS_KEY: The access method is access key.

type.description: The source from which data is imported.

s3.description: The configuration details for importing from Amazon S3.

gcs.description: The configuration details for importing from Google Cloud Storage.

azureBlob.description: The configuration details for importing from Azure Blob Storage.

s3Compatible.description: The configuration details for importing from a S3-compatible storage service.

oss.description: The configuration details for importing from Alibaba Cloud Object Storage Service (OSS).

v1beta1ImportSourceTypeEnum.description:
- S3: S3 source.
 - GCS: gcs source.
 - AZURE_BLOB: azure blob source.
 - S3_COMPATIBLE: S3 compatible source.
 - OSS: OSS source.

v1beta1ImportStateEnum.description:
- PREPARING: The import is preparing.
 - IMPORTING: The import is importing.
 - COMPLETED: The import is completed.
 - FAILED: The import is failed.
 - CANCELING: The import is canceling.
 - CANCELED: The import is canceled.

branches.description: A list of branches that match the query.

nextPageToken.description: The token to retrieve the next page of results. Use this value as the `pageToken` parameter in the next request. This field is empty when there are no more pages.

totalSize.description: The total number of branches that match the query.

v1beta1ListBranchesResponse.description: Message for response to list branches.

exports.description: A list of export tasks that match the query.

nextPageToken.description: The token to retrieve the next page of results. Use this value as the `pageToken` parameter in the next request. This field is empty when there are no more pages.

totalSize.description: The total number of exports that match the query.

imports.description: A list of import tasks that match the query.

totalSize.description: The total number of imports that match the query.

nextPageToken.description: The token to retrieve the next page of results. Use this value as the `pageToken` parameter in the next request. This field is empty when there are no more pages.

uri.description: The Alibaba Cloud OSS URI of the import source.

authType.description: The authentication method for accessing the Alibaba Cloud OSS source.

accessKey.description: The access key credentials used for accessing the Alibaba Cloud OSS source.

id.description: The AccessKey ID for accessing Alibaba Cloud OSS.

secret.description: The AccessKey secret for accessing Alibaba Cloud OSS.

uri.description: The Alibaba Cloud OSS URI of the export target.

authType.description: The authentication method for accessing Alibaba Cloud OSS.

accessKey.description: The Alibaba Cloud OSS access key credentials used for access.

id.description: The AccessKey ID for accessing Alibaba Cloud OSS.

secret.description: The AccessKey secret for accessing Alibaba Cloud OSS.

clusterId.description: The ID of the cluster to update.

displayName.description: The user-defined name of the cluster.

automatedBackupPolicy.description: The schedule and retention rules for automated database backups.

endpoints.description: The connection endpoints for accessing the cluster.

labels.description:
The labels for the cluster.

- `tidb.cloud/organization`: the ID of the organization where the cluster belongs.
- `tidb.cloud/project`: the ID of the project where the cluster belongs.

autoScaling.description: The auto-scaling configuration for the cluster.

v1beta1RegionCloudProvider.description:
Enum of cloud provider names.

 - aws: Amazon Web Services.
 - alicloud: Alibaba Cloud

uri.description: The S3-compatible storage URI of the import source.

authType.description: The authentication method for accessing the S3-compatible storage.

accessKey.description: The access key credentials used for accessing the S3-compatible storage.

endpoint.description:
The custom HTTPS endpoint for S3-compatible storage, which is used to connect to non-AWS storage providers, such as Cloudflare.
Must be a valid HTTPS URL, such as `https://custom-s3.example.com`.

id.description: The access key ID for accessing the S3-compatible storage.

secret.description: The secret access key for accessing the S3-compatible storage.

uri.description: The S3 URI of the import source.

authType.description: The authentication method for accessing the S3 bucket.

roleArn.description: The AWS IAM role ARN used for access.

accessKey.description: The AWS access key credentials used for access.

id.description: The access key ID for accessing the S3 source.

secret.description: The secret access key for accessing the S3 source.

uri.description: The S3 URI of the export target.

authType.description: The authentication method for accessing the S3 bucket.

accessKey.description: The AWS access key credentials used for access.

roleArn.description: The AWS IAM role ARN used for access.

id.description: The access key ID for accessing the S3 bucket.

secret.description: The secret access key for accessing the S3 bucket.
